## What are In situ observations?

::: incremental
-   "*In situ* observations are those made at the location of the instrument. With this definition a large variety of techniques qualify as in situ measurements." *sensu* Ehhalt (1980)

-   *In situ* observations provide the best and, in some cases, the only way to measure what we observe in nature...
:::

## What is data management?

::: {style="font-size:30px"}
-   Data management encompasses everything about how the data are collected, processed, stored, and archived.

-   Data management procedures and practices should be an integral part of any research project planning and should be in place prior to any data being collected.
:::

![](./images/process.png){fig-align="center" width="25%"}

::: callout-note
Efficient organization of the collected data (from the field or lab) and beyond...
:::

## Data Sheets

::: {style="text-align: center"}
**Data Files: Best Practices of Data**
:::

::: incremental
-   Columns (variables) & Rows (data)
    -   Single row of descriptive headers (Avoid spaces or starting headers with numbers)
-   Data disaggregation
    -   One cell per variable (e.g., toe length & tail length in separate columns)
-   Each cell has one type of data
    -   Cell should only contain numbers or letters.
    -   Not "3 eggs" -\> Header: EggNumber, Data: 3
-   Plain text
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Data Sheets

::: {style="text-align: center"}
**Data Files: Best Practices of Data**
:::

::: incremental
-   Columns (variables) & Rows (data)\
-   Use standardized formats for date/time/metric system
    -   Date: YYYY-MM-DD (Year-Month-Day)
    -   Time: hh:mm:ss (use 24-hour time)
:::

![](./images/americans.png){fig-align="center" width="90%"}

## Data Sheets

::: {style="text-align: center"}
**Data Files: Best Practices of Data**
:::

::: incremental

-   Use full taxonomic names

## Metadata

::: {style="text-align: center"}
**Metadata are data 'reporting'**
:::

::: incremental
-   WHO created the data?
-   WHAT are the contents of the data?
-   WHEN were the data created?
-   WHERE is it geographically?
-   HOW were the data developed?
-   WHY were the data developed?
:::
